data.description:
Experience a new kind of immersive horror in Dreadhalls!

You are trapped deep inside a massive dungeon. Explore it, survive it, and find a way to escape. Your only weapons will be stealth, your own courage, and a faint light.

Inspired by the survival horror and roguelike genres, Dreadhalls has been terrorizing people ever since its debut at the 2013 Oculus + Indiecade VR Jam.

Dreadhalls is an intense and scary experience, not for the faint of heart. You have been warned!

changelog.change_log: - Fixed issue where players using the Go or Gear VR controller would suddenly stop while walking or running forward

- Fixed game not properly detecting controller handedness changes during play
- Improved detection of active controller (either gamepad or 3DOF controller)
- Fixed player forward facing direction not aligning correctly along corridor walls when playing with a 3DOF controller
- Minor corrections in Chinese translation

- Fixed game freezing when loading the ending scene
- Added Chinese, Japanese, and Italian localizations (text only)
- Added an error message when no controller is connected
- Game will now pause when the headset is removed
- In-game menus and inventory will not clip through walls anymore
- Oculus Go: Improved visual quality. Plus other minor fixes.

- Increased dead zone for the "Sprint"  button to prevent some controllers from mistakenly detecting it as always pressed.
- Fixed disabling comfort mode during the game not working until the next scene reload.
- Fixed minor bug: app icon and name should now display correctly in Android's applications list

- Fixed freezing during load screen on some phones (Galaxy S8, S8+...) due to excessively long shader compilation.
- Fixed some monsters' noises being heard across the entire map.

- Added support for Samsung VR Controller
- Updated engine version
- Other minor fixes

- Updated Oculus SDK
- Fixed sound stutter in some Bluetooth audio devices.

- Integration with Oculus SDK 0.6.2.0
- Added a flicker effect to the player's light right before running out. Visibility on low light conditions has been slightly increased.
- Improvements on User Interface: Selection crosshair is no longer off-center. Text is now easier to read when buttons are selected. Intro menu buttons now play their sound effects correctly.
- Added some new tutorial prompts.
- The particle effect when unlocking doors in a hub map will no longer suddenly disappear.
- Fixed bug where using the headset's Back button also disabled the player's light.
